dialogue_turns.speaker: Valeriy from Astana
dialogue_turns.text: Heads up for anyone driving downtown on May 1st!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Heads up for anyone driving downtown on May first!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main road closures will be in effect on May 1 from 6:45 AM to 10:00 AM " during this time, Turkestan and Akmeshit streets will be closed in the section from EXPO to the Bayterek monument.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the Birlik Zhugirisi run is happening that morning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the Birlik Zhugirisi run is happening that morning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the city administration, several streets in the capital will be closed due to the national run "Birlik Zhugirisi " 2025".

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it's the 30th anniversary of the Assembly of People of Kazakhstan, so they're closing a bunch of streets for it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it's the thirtieth anniversary of the Assembly of People of Kazakhstan, so they're closing a bunch of streets for it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 1, Astana will host a run dedicated to the 30th anniversary of the Assembly of People of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, starting as early as 8 PM on April 30th, actually—Turkestan Street near EXPO will close for setting up the arch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, starting as early as eight P M on April thirtieth, actually-Turkestan Street near E X P O will close for setting up the arch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting at 8:00 PM on April 30, a section of Turkestan Street near the exhibition center will be closed for the installation of the starting arch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then from like, 6:45 to 10 AM on May 1st, the main closures kick in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then from like, six forty five to ten A M on May first, the main closures kick in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main road closures will be in effect on May 1 from 6:45 AM to 10:00 AM " during this time, Turkestan and Akmeshit streets will be closed in the section from EXPO to the Bayterek monument.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Turkestan and Akmeshit streets will be totally shut down between EXPO and the Bayterek monument.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Turkestan and Akmeshit streets will be totally shut down between E X P O and the Bayterek monument.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main road closures will be in effect on May 1 from 6:45 AM to 10:00 AM " during this time, Turkestan and Akmeshit streets will be closed in the section from EXPO to the Bayterek monument.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So if you usually drive through there, you're gonna wanna plan a detour.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So if you usually drive through there, you're gonna wanna plan a detour.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. The EXPO area is basically the hub for the whole event.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. The E X P O area is basically the hub for the whole event.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The EXPO IEC area will serve as the event's central location.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's cool though—a big national run right in the capital.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's cool though-a big national run right in the capital.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the city administration, several streets in the capital will be closed due to the national run "Birlik Zhugirisi " 2025".

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's for a meaningful anniversary too. Just… maybe take public transport that day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's for a meaningful anniversary too. Just... maybe take public transport that day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or just sleep in till ten!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Hah, not a bad idea. Thanks, Valeriy, for the heads-up!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hah, not a bad idea. Thanks, Valeriy, for the heads-up!
